title: Undertrial’s escape was planned during court hearings
text:
Amit Sharma
Tribune News Service
Chandigarh, October 19
The conspiracy to help notorious criminal Rajan Bhatti flee from police custody at the District Courts was hatched during court hearings. Bhatti’s accomplices, who helped him flee, used to meet him during the court hearings and plan the escape. On the day of the incident, Bhatti fled from the rear gate of the court complex, which leads to the public parking. Bhatti, an undertrial, had escaped from the custody of Constable Harbans Lal from the court complex after a hearing on October 13. He had fled with the handcuffs on. Bhatti’s friends Poonam, Rajbir, Sunny and Shubham Rathour had assisted him in the escape. Police sources said Bhatti’s friends used to meet him at the court during the hearings. “On the day of the incident, his accomplices were waiting outside the gate near the canteen,” said a police official. The sources said Bhatti’s girlfriend informed him that Rajbir, Sunny and Shubham were waiting outside the court in a car. The accused claimed that they fled towards Mohali. Bhatti, son of a constable of the Punjab Police, was earlier arrested on May 16 from Sector 9 following a chase. He had fired into the air on seeing a police party then. Bhatti has four cases registered against him in Chandigarh. Third accused in police net The third accused of the four who had helped Bhatti escape from the District Courts, has been arrested by the operations cell of the UT police. The accused, Shubham Rathour, son of a head constable of the Punjab Police, was arrested from his native village in Gurdaspur. While Poonam, alias Pooja, was arrested from the spot, Sunny was arrested on October 18 near Dera Mansar Mukerian, Hoshiarpur. Accused get police remand
Shubham and Sunny were produced in the court today, which remanded them in police custody till October 21.
